title: MINISTER PU B. LALCHHANZOVA DISBURSES MLA FUND TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY SPORTS INFRASTRUCTURE
content:
329/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, the 7th January, 2026:Minister Pu B. Lalchhanzova, who is also the MLA of Aizawl East–II Constituency, today disbursed financial assistance from his MLA Fund for the upgradation of sports facilities within his constituency. The funds were handed over at his Office Chamber at MINECO. An amount of Rs. 7,00,000 was presented to the office bearers of Chhinga Veng Branch YMA for the upgradation of the Chhinga Veng Branch YMA Gym, while Rs. 2,68,000 was also handed over to the office bearers of the Dawrpui Badminton Club for the renovation of the Dawrpui Badminton Hall.

On the occasion, Minister Pu B. Lalchhanzova emphasized the importance of sports among the youth and stated that it is encouraging to see Mizo youth making steady progress in the field of sports. He also remarked that the presence of Mizo sportspersons who bring recognition and pride to the Mizo community at the national and international levels is commendable. He further assured that he would continue to extend his best efforts to ensure that young people are able to progress in sports and recreational activities.

On their part, the leaders of Chhinga Veng Branch YMA and Dawrpui Badminton Club expressed their appreciation for having an MLA who is concerned about the welfare and future of the youth. They also assured that the assistance received from the MLA Fund would be utilized effectively for the benefit of the people of the constituency.

title: CM-IN MINECO-A ENGINEERS’ CENTRE SAKNA TUR HMUNAH LUNGPHUM A PHUM
content:
2813/2025-2026

Dated Aizawl, the 7th January, 2026 :Vawiin chawhma khân Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma chuan MINECO-ah Engineers’ Centre sakna tur Lungphûm a phûm.

Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma chuan he lung phum programme-ah hian thusawiin, Mizoram Engineering Service Association (MESA) member-ten Engineers’ Club sakna tura sum an thawhkhawm chu fakawm a tih thu leh entawntlak a tih thu a sawi a. Sawrkar Engineer-te chu kan ram hmasawnna ruhrel dinna kawng tinrenga a mawhphurtute in ni a, in kutah hmasawnna hnathawhna tur sum pawh a lut hnem a, inpe zo taka hna in thawh hi kan beisei tlat a ni, a ti a. Infrastructure tha pakhatin kan economy a nghawng theihzia chu rel kawng atang hian a hmuh theih thu sawiin, Sairang thleng rel rawn lut chuan mipui nawlpui tan zinchhuah a ti awlsam a, kan sumdawngten man tlawm zawkin bungrua an lalut a, khualzin rawn lut an tamin Tourism Industry a kan phah thu a sawi a. Hei hian infrastructure tha hlutzia min hmuhtirin, Engineer kalkhawmte chu kan ram hmasawnna tura dik tak leh tha taka hnathawk zel turin leh he Engineer’s Club hi an hnathawhna lama tangkai taka hmang turin duhsakna a hlan a ni.

Chief Minister chuan Mizoram chu eirukna lakah pawh kan fihlim tlan thu sawiin, CMS India Study chuan NITI Aayog leh Transparency International data-te atanga an teh danin, tunah hian Mizoram hi India rama eirukna tlem lama pahnihna kan nih thu a tarlang a. Pakhatna chu mihring sing sarih vel chauh chenna Laksadweep (Union Territory) a ni a, State zingah Mizoram chu pakhatna kan ni a. Works Department-te kalphung zirchiang a, kalphung tha zawk siamtu tur Study Team din a nih thu leh an report pawh thlirho a nih tawh thu Pu Lalduhoma chuan a tarlang a. Study Team-in tha zawka hmalak dan tur leh insiamthatna tur rawtna an neihte bawhzuia Works lama kan kalphung tam tak hi a tha zawnga tih danglam tum a nih thute a sawi bawk a ni.

Engineer-te hian Zarkawt Babu tlângah Engineers’ Club changtlung tak an nei thin a. Engineer-te inthlunkhawmna pawl ‘Mizoram Engineering Service Association (MESA)’ chu Department hrang hrang awmkhawm an nih avangin chu hmun chu an hna chungchang sawiho nânte, Conference neih nânte, Aizawl pawn lama posting nei tân Headquarters dawra Aizawl an rawn kal chânga thlen nânte leh thil ṭul dang chi hrang hrang atan an hmang ṭhin a. Kum 2011 khân sawrkar-in Engineer-te building leh ram chu Zarkawt YMA hnenah Stadium cum Recreation & Parking Centre atan a pek tak avangin Engineers te chuan hmun leh building an nei ta lo a. Hmunhma pe leh tura vawi tam tak thuneitute an dil hnuah June 12, 2024 khân sawrkar chuan MINECO-a plot no. B-39 chu Engineers Centre atan a pe ta a ni.

Engineers’ Centre hi sak puitlin a nih hunah chuan Engineer-te tân chauh nilo, sawrkar department hrang hrang te, sawrkar hnathawk Association hrang hrang te, NGO, Kohhran leh mimal thlengin a mamawh apiang tan hman theih tura buatsaih tum a ni a. Engineer-te bik chuan seminar leh conference neih nân te, Works Department hrang hrang kârah thawhho dan tur sawikhawm nân te, technical thila inrawnkhawm nân te, senior member te’n junior zawkte hnena an hnathawhna kawnga an tawnhriat inhrilh nân te, technical mite tâna ṭangkai tur lehkhabute daha technical library anga hman atante, codes, manual, technical paper leh journal hrang hrang dahkhawm nân te, training neih nân te, Aizawl pawn lama awm engineer-te’n headquarters an rawn dâwr chânga thlen nân te, transit accommodation leh a tul dang atante hman tur a ni ang.

Vawiin lung phum programme hi Er. Lalrinzuala Ralte, President, MESA, chuan a kaihruai a, Er PC David Lalrinliana, General Secretary, MESA hnen atangin report ngaihthlak niin, Er Lalrinmawia, Chairman, Engineers’ Centre Working Committee chuan lawmthu sawiin hun a khar a ni. Engineers’ Centre sak turah hian mi 500 len theihna Conference hall a awm dawn bakah technical discussion room, family transit accommodation, committee room, guest room, canteen leh motor parking te a awm dawn a ni. Engineer-te hian an Centre sakna atan hian Rs. 21,83,000/- an thawhkhawm tawh a, thawh zel pawh an tum a ni.

title: COUNCIL OF MINISTERS MEETING
content:
328/2025-2026

Aizawl, 7 January 2026:The Council of Ministers met today at the Cabinet Room of the Chief Minister’s Office, Aizawl, under the chairmanship of Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma. The meeting discussed matters relating to the Chakma Autonomous District Council (CADC), in response to the Governor of Mizoram seeking the advice of the Council of Ministers.

The Governor had sought the opinion of the Council of Ministers on whether a fresh Inquiry Commission should be constituted to examine the functioning of the Chakma Autonomous District Council. In this regard, the Council of Ministers noted that an Inquiry Commission to examine the functioning of the CADC had already been constituted earlier and its report had been duly submitted. Subsequently, a Study Team to examine the functioning of all three Autonomous District Councils was constituted under the leadership of the Chief Secretary, and its report has also been submitted. In addition, the Deputy Commissioner, Lawngtlai, has submitted a separate report on the Chakma Autonomous District Council. The Council of Ministers observed that these three reports are adequate, and therefore, there is no necessity to constitute a fresh Inquiry Commission.

The Governor also sought the advice of the Council of Ministers on whether the Chakma Autonomous District Council should continue under Governor’s Rule. On this matter, the Council of Ministers noted that in the CADC, out of 20 MDC members, there are 16 members belonging to a party capable of forming the government. And in accordance with the directions earlier issued by the High Court to explore all possible means for formation of a government, the Council of Ministers had recommended that a government be allowed to be formed instead of continuing Governor’s Rule. However, Governor’s Rule was imposed.

The Council of Ministers further observed that even after the expiry of the present term of Governor’s Rule, the party capable of forming the government continues to be in a position to do so without any change in its strength. Therefore, the Council of Ministers found no justification, on grounds of political instability or otherwise, for extending Governor’s Rule for another six months. The Council of Ministers is of the view that a stable government can be formed in the Chakma Autonomous District Council.

title: AIZAWL MUNICIPAL CORPORATION GENERAL ELECTION, 2026 A HMAN TUR ELECTORAL ROLLS TLANGZARH
content:
2808/2025-2026

AIZAWL; the 7thJanuary, 2026:Vawiin khan DC Pisapui Hall-ah, District Election Officer, Aizawl District Er.Lalhriatpuia, IAS chuan Aizawl Municipal Corporation General Election, 2026 a hman tur Final Electoral Rolls a tlangzarh. He Final Electoral Rolls hi  State Election Commission, Mizoram thuchhuak angin  qualifying date  atan 01.01.2026 hmanga Electoral Rolls Summary Revision, 2026 neih a buatsaih a ni. AMC General Election neih hun tur chu State Election Commission, Mizoram in hriattirna a la rawn tichhuak leh ang.

Aizawl Municipal Corporation Draft Electoral Rolls buatsaihna  kalpui dan chu he tiang hi a ni:

Aizawl Municipal Corporation Draft Electoral Rolls chu ni 24.09.2025 khan mipui te en theih turin tarchhuah a lo ni tawh a. Ni 25.09.2025 atanga ni 25.10.2025 thleng AMC Electoral Roll atanga paih, thun thar, siamthat ngai leh insawn duh te tan dilna (claims and objections) chu Local Level Officer (LLO) te hnenah thehluhna hun hawn a ni.

Ni 25.09.2025 – ni 25.10.2025 chhunga dilna lut chu ni 26.10.2025 – ni 25.11.2025 chhungin Municipal Electoral Registration Officer (MERO)/Asst. Municipal Electoral Registration Officer (AMERO) ten an endik a. Hetiang an enfiah zawh hnu hian MERO-ten thutlukna an siam fel hnuah hming thunluh ngai, paih ngai leh siamthat ngaite chu thliar hran leh a ni a, hemi hnu hian Data entry (Computer-a thunluh hna) thawh zui nghal char char a ni. AMC Final Electoral Roll hi vawiin January 7, 2026 hian peih fel a tar chhuah/tlngazarh a lo ni ta a ni.

Tun tum AMC Final Electoral Rolls a voter awm zat chu hmeichhia – 129656, leh Mipa – 110333 an ni a, an vaiin voters hi ni 239989 an awm a, Mipa ai hmeichhia an tamna chu 19323 a ni.  Voter  tamna ber Ward hi WARD XVIII niin, voter  18906 an awm a. A tlemna ber Ward hi WARD VIII niin; voters  7975 an awm thung. Voters pun( Increase) tamna ber ward hi WARD  XI niin; voters  804 in an pung a, voters kiam( decrease) tamna ber Ward hi WARD XIV niin; voters 210 in an kiam thung a ni.

title: COUNCIL OF MINISTERS THUKHAWM
content:
2806/2025-2026

Aizawl the 7th January 2026:Nizan khan Council of Ministers chu Chief Minister Pu Lalduhoma kaihhruaiin Chief Minister Office Cabinet room-ah an thukhawm a. Chakma Autonomous District Council chungchanga Mizoram Governor-in Council of Ministers thurawn (Advice) hriat a duh chungchang an sawiho.

Governor hian Chakma Autonomous District Council kal dan chhui chiangtu tur Inquiry Commission thar din tha an tih leh tih loh thuah Council of Ministers ngaihdan hriat a duh a. He mi thuah hian nizana Council of Ministers thukhawm hian, Chakma Autonomous District Council kalphung chhui chiangtu Inquiry Commission hi din a lo ni tawh a, an report pawh an thehlut tawh a. Chu mi hnuah Autonomous District Councils pathumte kalphung zirchiangtu Study Team, Chief Secretary kaihhruaina hnuaiah din a ni leh a, an report an thehlut tawh a. Lawngtlai Deputy Commissioner pawhin Chakma Autonomous District Council chungchang report a thehlut tawh bawk a. Heng report pathumte hi an tha tawk a. A hranpaa Inquiry Commission din tharleh hi a tul tawh lovah a ngai a ni.

Governor hian Chakma Autonomous District Council chu Governor's Rule a dah chhunzawm zel tur chi a nih leh nih loh thuah Council of Ministers ngaihdan (Advice) hriat a duh bawk a. He mi thuah hian nizana Council of Ministers thukhawm chuan, Chakma Autonomous District Council-ah hian MDC member 20 a member 16 neia sorkarna siam thei Party an awm avang leh High Court-in sorkarna siamtir dan kawng zawng tura thurawn a lo pek tawh angin Governor's Rule-a dah lova sorkarna siamtir turin ngenna a lo siam tawh a. Nimahsela Governor's Rule-ah hian dah a ni ta thova. He Governor's Rule term a zawh hnuah pawh hian sorkarna siam thei party te hian an dinhmun sawh sawn lova sorkarna an la siam theih reng avangin Governor's Rule-a thla ruk dang dah leh a tulna chhan (political instability) engmah a awmin a hre lova. CADC ah hian sorkar ngelnghet tak a ding thei tih hi Council of Ministers ngaihdan a ni.
